newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina considering more U.S. beef protests.
newsitem.headline: Argentina considering more U.S. beef protests.

text.p: Argentina is planning more formal protests to the United States over slow progress in gaining sanitary approval for a 20,000-tonne beef export quota, Agriculture Secretary Felipe Sola said Thursday.

"We have been complaining in the United States for some time. We have waited until the (U.S.) elections which have undoubtedly been a factor in the (U.S.) government's reserve in taking decisions," Sola told Reuters.
"But I will possibly be going to Washington in December over this question...to express our concern because what was agreed two years ago still has not been complied with," he said.
He added "For Argentina, installing itself in the American beef market would be a step towards getting into the Japanese and Korean markets."
The U.S. government decided to grant Argentina access to its beef market as a result of its elimination of foot and mouth disease, but final sanitary approval by U.S. authorities is still pending.
